WorkItem.Description:
Dear,
 
I have produced a self-contained solution demonstrating a problem about current cell information, after deleting that cell's row.
 
Thanks,
 
Julie
 
Procedure
------------
Unzip annexed file
Start Visual Studio 2008 and adjust the reference to 'WPFToolkit.dll' (I used v3.5.40128.1) in the  solution project
 
Scenario
----------
Start Application ... this shows the grid and a DOS console  as well
 
Step 1:
Enter grid with mouse 'floating above it' in and out ... console displays (see Window1.xaml.cs : method void dataGrid1_LayoutUpdated(object sender, EventArgs e)) :
[...LayoutUpdated
FruitList.Count:5
CurrentCell.Column      : null
CurrentItem: null
    LayoutUpdated...]
	
Now comes the problem :
 
Step 2:
To delete a row, just click on (e.g.) cell containing 'B' ... console displays (see Window1.xaml.cs : method void dataGrid1_CurrentCellChanged(object sender, EventArgs e)) :
[...CurrentCellChanged
FruitList.Count:5
CurrentCell.Column.Index: 0
CurrentItem: B
    CurrentCellChanged...]
 
After this, the current cell and item information remains 'B' even if 'B' has been removed from the list. The experiment can be repeated with other rows.
 
Step 3:
[...LayoutUpdated
FruitList.Count:4
CurrentCell.Column.Index: 0
CurrentItem: B
    LayoutUpdated...]
 
Remark:
---------
The value of 'IsSynchronizedWithCurrentItem' has no influence on the outcome. So I did not set it on the datagrid. 
	
Note :
--------
The production case was about the user selecting row B with a Context menu the right click to delete that row.
This got the row 'B' selected because of the mouse gesture before the row was deleted .
I simplified the problem just by having to click on row B, instead of opening a context menu.
WorkItem.Summary: Datagrid : 'current item' information after 'delete row' is invalid
